intro: Anthistiria puberula, commonly known as the hairy anthistiria, is a small, herbaceous plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
